Basic Formatted Output

Basic formatted output:

cout << ...

Using function call syntax:

coutf(...)

All format specification characters table Format state restored at end of op Must consume all FM Can have more objects than FM

Attention: all ops that are not type-specific apply to object rather than subojects

Basic Formatted Input

Basic formatted input:

cin <<

Using function call syntax:

cinf(...

10 objects max, not include iof::fmt_spec

Otherwise same characteristics as output

Persistent formats

S: FSC will be applied as default to next FM Mechanism to remove duplicate format spec chars: 5.2S s s s 10S s s s instead of 5.2s 5.2s 5.2s 5.2s 10.2s 10.2s 10.2s 10.2s

available for both input and output cumulative local override

Dynamic formatting

If need to create FSC on the fly iof::fmt_spec Doesn't consume a marker; instead, applies to next marker Cumulative + override available for both input and output Good way to document complex format ops Good way to move FSC out of FS: eg hex(Obj)

Output to a string

Helps creating a string from a format string

std::string a = iof::stringizer("...") << ...

Using function call syntax:

std::string a = iof::tostr("...", ...)

Allows split of formatting op, until converted to string: must have consumed all FM

Exception info for inputs

What caused exception, and which input, available

Skipping input

Can skip input
